bibl.title: Territory of Washington v. Walker et al. Summary of Case
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image.

org.orgName: United States District Court For The Western District of Washington Northern Division

div1.p: watch the body: left night watchman of the water works upon the ground in charge of body while I returned to city: The engine was running backward and pulling out after it: I do not throw deceased and know nothing further regarding the matter

Hm rale: Engineer witch engine sworn: testifies At the time when run over man the fireman was throwing coal into the firebo and consequently I couldn't see well: was misty and dark at the time: saw nothing of man before was run over: but saw dog run aside from the track: recming around the curve was on Engines: side of Engine and couldn't see over two or three car lengths ahead under favorable circumstances: man lay next opposite track: was running light o & ten miles an hour: heard Mr Thompson holler to "shut her off" or "hold her up". and immediately did so: stopped within two or three quarterlengths of where body lay" train hands went back and as they did not quickly return, I followed them found man as disended by Mr McKay upon track" Mr Kirkbride returned to notify authorities while I and the other train hands proceeded to stock yards: could feel far of Engine tender as it passed over mans body: do not think could have done so had another train passed over his body prior to my engine: think that I run over man first was about 2.30 am: could find no evidence upon Engine that it had stuck man
Walter Osgood. Fireman. switch engine sworn was fiesing at the time man was run over: went
